verses.verse: My son<WH1121>, forget<WH7911> not my law<WH8451>; but let thine heart<WH3820> keep<WH5341> my commandments<WH4687>:
For length<WH753> of days<WH3117>, and long<WH8141> life<WH2416>, and peace<WH7965>, shall they add<WH3254> to thee.
Let not mercy<WH2617> and truth<WH571> forsake<WH5800> thee: bind<WH7194> them about thy neck<WH1621>; write<WH3789> them upon the table<WH3871> of thine heart<WH3820>:
So shalt thou find<WH4672> favour<WH2580> and good<WH2896> understanding<WH7922> in the sight<WH5869> of God<WH430> and man<WH120>.
¶ Trust<WH982> in the LORD<WH3068> with all thine heart<WH3820>; and lean<WH8172> not unto thine own understanding<WH998>.
In all thy ways<WH1870> acknowledge<WH3045> him, and he shall direct<WH3474> thy paths<WH734>.
¶ Be not wise<WH2450> in thine own eyes<WH5869>: fear<WH3372> the LORD<WH3068>, and depart<WH5493> from evil<WH7451>.
It shall be health<WH7500> to thy navel<WH8270>, and marrow<WH8250> to thy bones<WH6106>.
Honour<WH3513> the LORD<WH3068> with thy substance<WH1952>, and with the firstfruits<WH7225> of all thine increase<WH8393>:
So shall thy barns<WH618> be filled<WH4390> with plenty<WH7647>, and thy presses<WH3342> shall burst out<WH6555> with new wine<WH8492>.
¶ My son<WH1121>, despise<WH3988> not the chastening<WH4148> of the LORD<WH3068>; neither be weary<WH6973> of his correction<WH8433>:
For whom the LORD<WH3068> loveth<WH157> he correcteth<WH3198>; even as a father<WH1> the son<WH1121> in whom he delighteth<WH7521>.
¶ Happy<WH835> is the man<WH120> that findeth<WH4672> wisdom<WH2451>, and the man<WH120> that getteth<WH6329> understanding<WH8394>.
For the merchandise<WH5504> of it is better<WH2896> than the merchandise<WH5505> of silver<WH3701>, and the gain<WH8393> thereof than fine gold<WH2742>.
She is more precious<WH3368> than rubies<WH6443>: and all the things thou canst desire<WH2656> are not to be compared<WH7737> unto her.
Length<WH753> of days<WH3117> is in her right hand<WH3225>; and in her left hand<WH8040> riches<WH6239> and honour<WH3519>.
Her ways<WH1870> are ways<WH1870> of pleasantness<WH5278>, and all her paths<WH5410> are peace<WH7965>.
She is a tree<WH6086> of life<WH2416> to them that lay hold<WH2388> upon her: and happy<WH833> is every one that retaineth<WH8551> her.
The LORD<WH3068> by wisdom<WH2451> hath founded<WH3245> the earth<WH776>; by understanding<WH8394> hath he established<WH3559> the heavens<WH8064>.
By his knowledge<WH1847> the depths<WH8415> are broken up<WH1234>, and the clouds<WH7834> drop down<WH7491> the dew<WH2919>.
¶ My son<WH1121>, let not them depart<WH3868> from thine eyes<WH5869>: keep<WH5341> sound wisdom<WH8454> and discretion<WH4209>:
So shall they be life<WH2416> unto thy soul<WH5315>, and grace<WH2580> to thy neck<WH1621>.
Then shalt thou walk<WH3212> in thy way<WH1870> safely<WH983>, and thy foot<WH7272> shall not stumble<WH5062>.
When thou liest down<WH7901>, thou shalt not be afraid<WH6342>: yea, thou shalt lie down<WH7901>, and thy sleep<WH8142> shall be sweet<WH6149>.
Be not afraid<WH3372> of sudden<WH6597> fear<WH6343>, neither of the desolation<WH7722> of the wicked<WH7563>, when it cometh<WH935>.
For the LORD<WH3068> shall be thy confidence<WH3689>, and shall keep<WH8104> thy foot<WH7272> from being taken<WH3921>.
¶ Withhold<WH4513> not good<WH2896> from them to whom it is due<WH1167>, when it is in the power<WH410> of thine hand<WH3027> to do<WH6213> it.
Say<WH559> not unto thy neighbour<WH7453>, Go<WH3212>, and come again<WH7725>, and to morrow<WH4279> I will give<WH5414>; when thou hast<WH3426> it by thee.
Devise<WH2790> not evil<WH7451> against thy neighbour<WH7453>, seeing he dwelleth<WH3427> securely<WH983> by thee.
¶ Strive<WH7378> not with a man<WH120> without cause<WH2600>, if he have done<WH1580> thee no harm<WH7451>.
¶ Envy<WH7065> thou not the oppressor<WH376><WH2555>, and choose<WH977> none of his ways<WH1870>.
For the froward<WH3868> is abomination<WH8441> to the LORD<WH3068>: but his secret<WH5475> is with the righteous<WH3477>.
¶ The curse<WH3994> of the LORD<WH3068> is in the house<WH1004> of the wicked<WH7563>: but he blesseth<WH1288> the habitation<WH5116> of the just<WH6662>.
Surely he scorneth<WH3887> the scorners<WH3887>: but he giveth<WH5414> grace<WH2580> unto the lowly<WH6035><WH6041>.
The wise<WH2450> shall inherit<WH5157> glory<WH3519>: but shame<WH7036> shall be the promotion<WH7311> of fools<WH3684>.
